title: Fedora Linux
summary: Fedora Linux[7] is a Linux distribution developed by the community-supported Fedora Project which is sponsored primarily by Red Hat, a subsidiary of IBM, with additional support from other companies.[8] Fedora contains software distributed under various free and open-source licenses and aims to be on the leading edge of free technologies.[9][10][11] Fedora is the upstream source of the commercial Red Hat Enterprise Linux distribution and for CentOS.[12] Fedora is a fork of Red Hat Linux since RHL was discontinued in 2003.
